oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nursing class
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: John Gaston School of Nursing; education; medicine; nursing; women; 1940s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "All phases of nursing demand rigid training in medical schooling. In the picture, at the right, Miss Anne Taylor, at the John Gaston School of Nursing, instructs a class of attentive students. The course of training at St. Joseph's Hospital is similar to that at the John Gaston and other Class A hospitals."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Day and Elliott
